Legal_Issue: Whether Mr. Acharige has satisfied the three-part test for a stay of removal from Canada
Application_Facts: Mr. Acharige argues the PRRA Officer erred in assessing his risk claims; however, the court found his arguments speculative and unsupported by credible evidence
Decision_Outcome: The court denied the motion to stay Mr. Acharige's removal from Canada
Grounds_for_Claim: Political involvement and alleged murder ties in Sri Lanka
Legal_Standard: Three-part test: serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Assessment_Factor: Risk on return to Sri Lanka
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review following unsuccessful refugee claim and PRRA decision
Credibility_Assessment: Arguments found speculative and unsupported by credible evidence
Application_Basis: Perceived risk due to political involvement and alleged criminal association
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of credible evidence supporting risk claims
Governing_Rule: Three-part test for stay of removal
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Speculative claims, lack of credible evidence
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of harm in Sri Lanka not substantiated
Cause_Description: Mr. Acharige claimed he would face risks in Sri Lanka due to political involvement and alleged murder ties
Evidence_Handling: Claims not supported by credible evidence; rejected by RPD and PRRA Officer
Evidence_Issues: Lack of credible and corroborative evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Findings by RPD and PRRA Officer that Mr. Acharige was not at risk in Sri Lanka
Decision_Rationale: No serious issue to be tried, no irreparable harm shown, balance of convenience does not favor applicant
Decision_Making_Body: PRRA Officer, Refugee Protection Division (RPD), Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Speculative nature of claims, lack of documentary or testimonial support
Legal_Standard_Applied: Three-part test for stay of removal
